112.content:
Alex was in between semesters at college and after his girlfriend dumped him needed something to occupy his mind. When his grandfather asked him to help clean out his attic he jumped at the opportunity to do something other than think about his situation. The work was more backbreaking than he first imagined, apparently his grandpa owned more heavy antique furniture than he remembered. After moving a box, full of what could only be bricks given the weight, he knocked over an old old Arabic oil lantern, the type you'd see in Aladdin. He joked with his grandpa, asking if it was real. At the end of the day his grandpa handed him the lamp laughing, telling him it was payment for helping out. Alex chuckled and accepted the gift thinking nothing of it until he got home. Exhausted he sat the lamp down on the table and starred longingly at it, wishing that things could be fixed with a simple trinket. With nothing to lose but looking silly he brushed the dust off the lamp and gave it a good polish. Suddenly the lamp rumbled and fell from his hands landing back on the table. The lamp shock more and more violently until finally a blast of blue smoke erupted from the tip. Alex coughed as smoke filled his room obscuring the floor.

"Mmmhhh, It's been so long." A sultry female voice moaned.

Alex looked up and saw a Arabic woman suddenly standing in the room stretching her arms. She was thin with a dancer's physique, long black hair pulled into a ponytail by a golden brace. Her skin was tan covered by a semi transparent blue harem outfit.

"Who are you?" Alex coughed finally able to speak once the smoke cleared.

"I am Nadia, master. A Djinn." Nadia explained her tone almost bored. "For freeing me I will grant you three wishes. Wish and you will be given exactly what you ask for."

"This is amazing." Alex said grinning widely.

Nadia looked at Alex drooling with ideas and sighed. Things hadn't changed much in how ever many thousand of years she was gone. "What is your desire master?" Nadia said breaking the silence.

"Okay I know exactly what I want first."

121.content:
I've just arrived school, hurried to the shelter of the school building from the drizzle rain. I watched the bus as it leave the school terminal. I wasn't very particular in taking the bus,correction, I totally hate the bus and wouldn't have ridden it if it hadn't been for the rain.
I'd requested my uncle who I'm living with to lend me his car which I think is over 80 years old which other people some in my generation would call junk; I'm into antiques so I don't really mind driving the red 1956 Chevrolet Corvette convertible.

'Oi Rica! What's going on?' a male approached me accompanied by a female.

I shot back a smile to them as they approached me. 'You guys are early. But I supose it's fine since you guys have a car on your own.' I shrugged.

'Your uncle hasn't gave in yet?' the female asked, a timid smile appeared on her thin red lips.

'No. Unfortunately. Buy hey, can I ride with you guys? I mean... If you don't mind.' I glanced at the male, noticed that teh two had exchanged looks. I know that they were going out, although they don't tell anyone (which includes me) yet worried how their parents would oppose to it. I've gotten used to how trivial thinking about those kind of matters which I wish something would change.
'Listen, forget it okay!' I shot another smile. 'I'll take the bus.'

'It's okay Rica.' the male hit my head with the two centimeter book which he had been holding, knocked my head light. He smiled, 'It's okay. I don't mind.'

The female grabbed my arm, tugged me as the school bell rang.
I walked along with them in the hallway going to our class.
'Damn!' the male suddenly cursed. I noticed that he was looking somewhere else. I followed where his gaze ended.
Ah, I saw two guys dragging a small skinny male out of the hallway. My eyes met the skinny boy's eyes. I couldn't pry my eyes from him, instinct or not I was drawn to him. I pulled away from my friends, ran after the three that quickly disappeared before my eyes. I didn't stop even as my friends called out to me. I ran and ran until I could no longer hear my friends' voices which I find odd since I know I wasn't that far from them.

'Some freak you are.!' one of the two guys uttered.
'Better know your place kid.' the other said as he punched the skinny male.
My eyes widened as I saw the scene, I started to wonder what exactly I was thinking following them.

The skinny male caught glimpse of me - pretty blue eyes like a gem solely focused on me. I saw him grin, and pretty sure he directed it at me. I couldn't help shiver.
The skinny male received another hit, this time on his stomach which made him kneel. His gaze still directed at me.

'Wha?' I realized too late that the two males' attention are on me now. I looked around searches for something knowing that it is I who is in danger now. I know the two males who doesn't care about anything as long as they get what they want.

'WHat do you want?' I hear a voice ring in my head. I don't know what it was, all I could think of is my desire to fight them off. I wish I could fight.

'Granted...' the voice trailed off.

Before I knew it, I actually hit one of the males down on the ground with my skinny arm WITH MY SKINNY ARM leaving me dumbfounded. as I stare at the male on the floor. I wasn't exactly off the hook with the other one glaring at me obviously angry at whatever I have done to his companion. He launched an attack which I don't know how I evaded. My right leg already had contact to the male's face which also knocked him down.
I felt my knees weaken, relief flood in that everything had ended. I sat on the ground trying to grasp what happened. I wasn't a fighter, never learned any fighting skill, watched but can a person fight so easily, that I am not sure.

'Wish granted!' somebody hummed. I turned and saw that it was actually the skinny male. He reached out a hand to help me stand. ''You really can fight huh?' he said with a grin. 'Guess it's thanks to your body built. Being healthy is good!'

I wasn't listening to him anymore, too focused on trying to understand what happened.

'Didn't you wish for a thrill in yor life? A change?'

I shot a glare at him, recalls that before I had followed this skinny male, I was just thinking about a change, something random under the wheather because of the rain.

'Now. Now.' he voiced, I stiffened, too late to realize that his face close to mine. Cold hands touched my chin as he forced me to face him. 'Isn't it your wish?'
I felt a chill as I looked at him. A beautiful face first time I had seen up close which sent a shiver to my spine - something dangerous. 'Now I should remind you, be careful of what you wish for.' his voice trailed off.
A loud explosion occurred, panic rouse in the school as the fire alarm rang.
I turned my attention to the skinny male to find him gone. The moment I had met his gaze I should have turned around - a dangerous appearance. His appearance meant that from now on, my life will be filled with thrill just as I had requested.



_____ hehehe.... a short story really..... I think anyway thanks for those out there who might have a chance to read this...
121.title: wish to have a thrill in life

1251.content:
Lily was an average teenage girl. She had just turned eighteen years old, and was in high school. She had long red hair, pale skin, and ocean blue eyes. She was quite tall, standing at 5'7", and while she wasn't exactly skinny, she was very fit, doing several sports weekly.

She was a rather attractive girl, and several boys had secret crushes on her. However, the thing that had bothered Lily for years, was the fact that she was an only child. She had been taught privately in her earlier years, and had been very lonely. Despite her having many friends now, it had taken her years to make any real friends. She wasn't lonely anymore, but she had always wished that she had a twin sister.

One day, Lily is cleaning the house. Her parents had gone on a cruise for a month, and Lily had told them she'd be fine. She was eighteen, she could look after herself. After a few days, she had decided that it was about time to clean the house, since it was getting filthy.

While cleaning her parents bedroom, she found a cardboard box taped up under their bed. Curious, Lily took out her pocket knife, opening it to reveal a golden lamp. It looked incredibly expensive, but then again, her father was a doctor, and her mother was the CEO of her own company. Nevertheless, she wondered why this seemingly priceless lamp was just in a box under their bed, gathering dust.

Lily rubbed the dust off of the lamp, when a bright Golden light shone around the room. Lily closed her eyes, and when she opened them, a gorgeous woman stood in front of her.

The woman seemed to be Arabic in origin. Her skin was dark and smooth, without a mark on it. Her hair was tied tightly back in a braid. She wore a black leather jacket and tight jeans, with black thigh high leather boots. She was taller than Lily, standing at almost six foot, and was incredibly beautiful, and her dark eyes were hidden behind a pair of shades.

She looked down at Lily, who was sat in awe, holding the lamp. "Hey." She said, nonchalantly. "Alright, let's get this over with so I can go back home. Ahem. Greetings mortal, I'm the genie of the lamp, blah blah blah three wishes. Rules are: can't with for life or death or love, and you only get three wishes, no more." The genie stood leaning on Lily's parents dresser with one hand, the other tapping impatiently on her toned hip.

"You're... a genie?" Lily asked.

The woman groaned. "S'what I said, ain't it? Now hurry up, I ain't got all day hon." She was certainly unlike any genie you'd ever imagined.

"ummm ok. I wish that... I had a twin sister!" You wish. The genie sighs, clapping her hands. Literally in a puff of smoke, another girl appears. An exact doppelganger of you is standing in front of you and the genie.
1251.title: to have a twin sister

1252.content:
Lily was cleaning her mother's home, hoping to prove useful until she can rent an apartment. She was only 18 and still in her senior year of high school. She moved her fit frame around the room, cleaning up as her mother was on cruise for the next month. Bills were taken care of in advance, so all Lily had to do was hold down the fort while mom was out. She invited friends and even potential boyfriends over to the home over the past week, but someone still has to clean.

When cleaning under her parent's bed, she found a cardboard box holding a gold oil lamp. Her mother was a CEO for her own company, and her father was a doctor, so they could definitely afford this. But why keep it under the bed, collecting dust?

She wiped dust off, and smoke came from the tip of the lamp, forming an Arabic woman in all leather. She was taller than Lily even without her legs manifested, floating with an intimidating aura and glaring through dark shades. Apparently the stories of the Genie are true.

The genie looked down at Lily in disinterest, speaking out to her, "I am the djinn of this lamp. As you probably know, you can make any three wishes, able to rewrite the fabric of space and time itself." She then lowered her shades to give an intense glare to Lily. "And ONLY three. No wishing for more wishes"

Now, Lily was an only child, and always wanted a twin sister, but her friends were enough company for her. She was also raised well by her parents, and anything else she wanted was something she could get without a magical genie wish. Her parents raised her to take pride in hard work, and that she had to earn what she wanted...

... And she realized that if she could get more work done, she would fulfill her desires more easily. And so she said, "I wish I was more handy"

Unfortunately, genies are known for being mischievous spirits. The djinn smirked and performed hand seals, causing smoke to appear at Lily's sides. Lily expected enhanced strength or dexterity, and this she was going to have.

However, it came in the form of her gaining an extra two pairs of arms. Lily immediately was shocked to see she has six arms, six hands, "handy..."

He may have been teased for this in middle school, but things thankfully turned around in High School when he took pride in his girly look. It isn't really fun to tease someone if they are too proud to be offended.

Although today his pride has turned to vanity, and his girlfriend Debora seems to be a bit less interested in him. Kyle, much like a puppy, became desperate to regain her attention.

That was when Kyle came across a brass oil lamp in the beach, Debora out buying ice cream. He knew the stories of the genie's lamp, but thought it was all the imagination of Richard Francis Burton. Nonetheless, he brushed the sand off it for shits and giggles.

You can imagine the look of surprise on his face when a wispy image of a muscular Arabic woman in a veil came out. Apparently that genie stuff was true.

She floated before him, saying "I am the Djinn of the lamp, holder of cosmic power that can weave the cloth of reality. I will grant you three wishes: no more than that"
